import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem continuous_at_iff_sequential_criterion {a b x‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñù} (hab : a ‚â§ b) (hx‚ÇÄ : x‚ÇÄ ‚àà Icc a b)
    (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) :
    (ContinuousAt f x‚ÇÄ ‚àß (x‚ÇÄ = a ‚Üí ContinuousWithinAt f (Set.Ici a) x‚ÇÄ) ‚àß (x‚ÇÄ = b ‚Üí ContinuousWithinAt f (Set.Iic b) x‚ÇÄ)) ‚Üî
    (‚àÄ (x‚Çô : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù), (‚àÄ n, x‚Çô n ‚àà Icc a b) ‚Üí Tendsto x‚Çô atTop (nhds x‚ÇÄ) ‚Üí Tendsto (f ‚àò x‚Çô) atTop (nhds (f x‚ÇÄ))) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
‚Ä¢ f is a function defined on a closed interval $[a,b]$ and $\overline{x} \in [a,b]$ [tc_1]
‚Ä¢ f is continuous at $\overline{x}$ [def_1]
Therefore, we conclude:
‚Ä¢ For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that for any $x \in [a,b]$, if $|x - \overline{x}| < \delta$, then $|f(x) - f(\overline{x})| < \epsilon$ [l1].

Therefore, we conclude:

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
‚Ä¢ The assumption that f is discontinuous at $\overline{x}$ [def_3] leads to the construction of a sequence $\{x_n\}$
‚Ä¢ This sequence satisfies $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n=\overline{x}$ [l5]
‚Ä¢ This same sequence also satisfies that $\{f(x_n)\}$ does not converge to $f(\overline{x})$ [l6]
Therefore, we conclude:
‚Ä¢ If f is discontinuous at $\overline{x}$, then there exists a sequence $\{x_n\}$ converging to $\overline{x}$ for which $\{f(x_n)\}$ does not converge to $f(\overline{x})$. By contraposition, if for every sequence $\{x_n\}$ converging to $\overline{x}$, $\{f(x_n)\}$ converges to $f(\overline{x})$, then $f$ must be continuous at $\overline{x}$. [ts_2].
